steps.description: The last stop in the wide-multiplication tour is the tiny glue header that finalises backend selection during compilation.
The familiar `#if` block re-appears, but this time it only chooses which concrete implementation `header` to pull in.

There are no functions or data here1 just pre-processor wiring that makes the selected `inline 128-bit arithmetic` visible. Because every `source file` that needs wide multiplication includes this `header`, the entire build sees a single, `constant-time 128-bit API`, independent of the underlying platform.
